com.distiller.docs

Class PatternSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.distiller.docs.PatternSet

  • public class PatternSet
extends java.lang.Object
    PatternSet is a wrapper class that facilitates the management of patterns. Each pattern type requires one instance of PatternSet.
    Author:
    Kurt Englmeier

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PatternSet(java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> entries)
      The constructor takes the list of string entries

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean contains(java.lang.String name)
      checks if a particular pattern exists under the specified "name" in its plural or singular form.
      java.lang.String getPattern(int index)
      Returns the pattern from the set at a particular index.
      java.lang.String getPattern(java.lang.String name)
      Returns the pattern that corresponds to the search term.
      java.lang.String getPluralName(java.lang.String name)
      Returns the plural form of the pattern's identifier that corresponds to search term
      java.lang.String getStandardName(int index)
      The singular form of the pattern's identifier serves as standard name.
      java.lang.String getStandardName(java.lang.String name)
      The singular form of the pattern's identifier serves as standard name.
      boolean isPlural(java.lang.String name)
      checks if the search term corresponds to a plural form of a pattern's identifier.
      int size()
      Returns the size of the pattern collection.

    • Method Detail

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.lang.String name)
        checks if a particular pattern exists under the specified "name" in its plural or singular form.
        Parameters:
        name - String - search term
        Returns:
        true if there is a pattern that corresponds to this search term, otherwise false.

      • isPlural

        public boolean isPlural(java.lang.String name)
        checks if the search term corresponds to a plural form of a pattern's identifier.
        Parameters:
        name - String - search term
        Returns:
        true if search term corresponds to the plural form of a pattern's identifier.

      • getPattern

        public java.lang.String getPattern(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the pattern that corresponds to the search term.
        Parameters:
        name - String - search term
        Returns:
        pattern

      • getPattern

        public java.lang.String getPattern(int index)
        Returns the pattern from the set at a particular index.
        Parameters:
        index - index of the pattern
        Returns:
        pattern

      • getStandardName

        public java.lang.String getStandardName(java.lang.String name)
        The singular form of the pattern's identifier serves as standard name. In the end, this method returns the singular form that corresponds to the search term.
        Parameters:
        name - String - search term
        Returns:
        standard (singular) form of the search term

      • getStandardName

        public java.lang.String getStandardName(int index)
        The singular form of the pattern's identifier serves as standard name. In the end, this method returns the singular form that corresponds to the search term.
        Parameters:
        index - index of the pattern
        Returns:
        standard (singular) form of the search term

      • getPluralName

        public java.lang.String getPluralName(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the plural form of the pattern's identifier that corresponds to search term
        Parameters:
        name - String - search term
        Returns:
        plural form the search term. If there is no plural form the method returns null.

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the size of the pattern collection.
        Returns:
        size of the pattern collection.
